input_text:
Job Title: Account Analyst

Location: Bentonville, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Brain Corp is a San Diego, California, USA-based AI company creating transformative core technology for the robotics industry. Our purpose is to create autonomous technology that helps the real world work better. Brain's robotic and AI solutions help retailers ensure that the right product is on the right shelf at the right price, in a clean environment. Through the BrainOS® Robotics Platform, which powers the largest global fleet of the Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs) in operation in commercial public spaces, Brain Corp delivers insightful and efficient automated solutions in both commercial floor cleaning and inventory management, empowering organizations and their employees to achieve more. Brain Corp currently powers more than 30,000 AMRs, representing the largest fleet of its kind in the world. Brain Corp is funded by the SoftBank Vision Fund, Clearbridge, and Qualcomm Ventures.

Position Summary

As a member of the Customer Success team, the Account Analyst supports the operational use of Brain’s fleet of robots at Walmart. A successful team member will demonstrate the benefits of using autonomous robots to clients and suggest scalable solutions that grow utilization across Walmart stores. A strong candidate will have strength in data/analytics, a process engineering mindset, and a passion for serving clients.

This role is expected to spend time in stores learning from associates (end users) and applying those learnings for chain-wide execution. This role will use WMT/Brain data to discover trends and insights related to utilization. In addition to spending time in stores, this role will also support key clients at the corporate office (directly or in partnership with another Brain team member).

Essential Job Functions

Proactively monitor data that is collected from field robot operations.Support Pilot Programs and internal Brain Corp projects.Follow through on technical and non-technical actions that are identified through the robot fleet monitoring (including communication, training, and support).Prepare and deliver internal/external reports as needed/requested.Take the necessary actions to respond to collected data to include triage of problems, escalate and track problems, and contact customer sites and personnel as needed.Be able to independently resolve common technical issues that have been trained on.

Education And/or Work Experience Requirements

1-2 years of experience working with Walmart, Sam’s Club, or another retailer in a technical or customer service role.Experience with SQL (GCP BigQuery preferred) and BI Tools (Tableau, Grafana, or PowerBI preferred).

Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, And Other Characteristics

A passion for working with data and technical products to create business value.Intermediate level experience with Microsoft and Google G-suite applications.Reliability, dependability, and flexibility with changing customer requirements is required.Must be a self-starter and detail oriented.

Things That Make a Difference

Knowledge of Retail Link, Luminate, and other retailer data platforms is a plus. Knowledge of Python and other technical programming languagesJira, ZenDesk, and Confluence are a plus but not required.Ability to speak a foreign language is a plus but is not required.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Essential functions may require maintaining the physical condition necessary for sitting, walking or standing for periods of time; operating a computer and keyboard; use of hands to finger and grasp; talk and hear at normal room levels; visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned or to make general observations of facilities or structures; push or pull up to 20 pounds.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. Employees are exposed to the typical office environment with computers, printers and telephones.

Salary Range

The anticipated salary range is $69,865 to $90,413. The final salary offered to a successful candidate will be dependent on several factors that may include but are not limited to the type and length of experience within the job, type and length of experience within the industry, education, etc.

In addition to base pay, our competitive total rewards package consists of:

A discretionary annual target bonusStock options401(k) plan with match (no waiting period and immediate vesting)Comprehensive suite of insurance benefits for employees (and their families) to include a variety of medical plan options (including an HSA with employer contribution), dental, vision, life and disability insurance, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Legal/Identity support plans, pet insuranceAccess to Flexible Spending Accounts (Medical and Dependent Care)Generous paid time off including flexible vacation, Paid Sick Leave, time off for volunteering in the community, 10 paid company holidays, and a winter company shutdown

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Account Analyst
output_json.summary: Supports the operational use of Brain's fleet of robots at Walmart.
job_responsibilities: Monitor data from field robot operations
Support pilot programs and internal projects
Follow through on technical and non-technical actions
output_json.physical_requirements: Maintain physical condition for sitting, walking, standing, operating equipment, and visual acuity
output_json.company_information: Brain Corp is an AI company based in San Diego, California, USA, creating solutions for the robotics industry.
